00020 #include <string>
00021 #include "canonMotionless.hh"
00022 #include "uio.hh"
00023 
00024 canonMotionless::canonMotionless(std::string canonL, machineStatus prevStatus):canonLine(canonL, prevStatus) {
00025   match = true;
00026   handled = true;
00027   status.setEndPose(status.getStartPose());
00028 
00029   //match canonical commands. the string MUST be the complete command name
00030   if (clMatch("COMMENT")) {
00031     //do nothing
00032   } else if (clMatch("MESSAGE")) {
00033     uio::infoMsg("Message: " + canonTokens[3]);
00034   //} else if (clMatch("SPINDLE")) {
00035   //} else if (clMatch("MIST")) {
00036   //} else if (clMatch("ENABLE")) {
00037   //} else if (clMatch("FLOOD")) {
00038   } else if (clMatch("DWELL")) {
00039   //} else if (clMatch("FEEDRATE")) {
00040   } else if (clMatch("SET_FEED_RATE")) {
00041     handled = false;
00042   } else if (clMatch("SET_FEED_REFERENCE")) {
00043     handled = false;
00044   } else if (clMatch("SELECT_TOOL")) {
00045     handled = false;
00046   } else if (clMatch("CHANGE_TOOL")) {
00047     //for now, always assume it's ballnose. divide tool number by 16 to get diameter
00048     //i.e. tool 1 = 1/16" ball nose endmill, tool 24 = 1 1/2" ball nose endmill
00049     //TODO: implement tool table stuff
00050     //toolNumber n = tok2i(3);
00051     status.setTool(tok2i(3));
00052     handled = false;
00053   } else if (clMatch("USE_TOOL_LENGTH_OFFSET")) {
00054     handled = false;
00055   } else if (clMatch("SET_ORIGIN_OFFSETS")) {
00056 
00057   if (clMatch("(0.0000,")) {
00058     uio::infoMsg("Warning, input has reduced precision - expected more zeros: \n" + myLine );
00059   }
00060     handled = false; //because I still don't know what to do if we have the correct data...
00061   } else if (clMatch("USE_LENGTH_UNITS")) {
00062     handled = false;
00063   } else if (clMatch("SET_MOTION_CONTROL_MODE")) {
00064     handled = false;
00065   } else if (clMatch("SET_XY_ROTATION")) {
00066     handled = false;
00067   } else if (clMatch("SET_FEED_REFERENCE")) {
00068     handled = false;
00069   } else if (clMatch("SET_NAIVECAM_TOLERANCE")) {
00070     handled = false;
00071   } else if (clMatch("PROGRAM_END")) {
00072   } else if (clMatch("PROGRAM_STOP")) {
00073   } else if (clMatch("SELECT_PLANE(" )) {
00074     if (clMatch("XZ)")) {
00075       status.setPlane(CANON_PLANE_XZ);
00076     } else if (clMatch("YZ)")) {
00077       status.setPlane(CANON_PLANE_YZ);
00078     } else {// XY)
00079       status.setPlane(CANON_PLANE_XY);
00080     }
00081   } else match = false;
00082 
00083   if ( !match || !handled ) {
00084     std::string m;
00085     if (!handled) {
00086       m = "Warning, unhandled";
00087     } else {
00088       m = "Error, unknown";
00089       uio::infoMsg(m + " canonical command: " + canonL);
00090     }
00091   }
00092 }
00093

00095  SET_ORIGIN_OFFSETS(0.0000,  //this is a common canon statement. we are going to hijack it to produce a warning, because
00096  //the data we're getting was produced with a format of %.4f or so
00097  infoMsg(QString("Warning, input has reduced precision, expected more zeros: <br>") + canon_line );
00098  */
